channel.title: Those machines ain't gonna learn themselves on Soapbox Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in Those machines ain't gonna learn themselves on Soapbox Data Science

item.title: Back2Basics P.1 - e and log
item.description: The e You probably have heard the saying that “there is no force in the universe more powerful than compound interest”. It was supposedly said by Albert Einstein. The saying could be an urban legend but it points out the importance of the concept called exponential growth. Einstein could have said “there is no force in the universe more powerful than exponential growth” and he would have made the same point but I think there is this slight difference between them which is “possibility”.

item.title: About
item.description: Hey there! I hope you have a good time reading my content. Let me quickly introduce myself. My name is Mehmet (nice to meet you too!). I do data stuff and occasionally try to instruct to silicon based processors to make business decisions for me. My tools of trade are Python and its data/ai ecosystem packages. But, I’m also very fond of C++ (who doesn’t really?). Anyway, the main topics of this blog are data stuff, ai/ml and quantitative finance.
